head.citation-title: Compressed sensing for real measurements of quaternion signals
head.abstracts: © 2017 The Franklin InstituteThe paper concerns compressed sensing methods in the quaternion algebra. We prove that it is possible to uniquely reconstruct – by ℓ1 norm minimization – a sparse quaternion signal from a limited number of its real linear measurements, provided the measurement matrix satisfies so-called restricted isometry property with a sufficiently small constant. We also provide error estimates for the approximated reconstruction of a non-sparse quaternion signal from noisy and noiseless data.

organization.$: Faculty of Mathematics and Information Science
